trans-unit.source: Represents the attributes and metadata for an XML Web service method.
This class cannot be inherited.

<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo> is used primarily by a SOAP extension to interrogate the details of the XML Web service method with which the SOAP extension is configured to run.

Depending on how the SOAP extension is configured, it can find out details about the XML Web service method in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.GetInitializer%2A> method of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension> that takes a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo>.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo> provides details such as the XML Web service method's parameters by accessing the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo.Parameters%2A> property and any custom attributes applied to the XML Web service method using the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo.GetCustomAttributes%2A> property.

For more details on SOAP extensions see the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension> class or [[\<topic://cpconAlteringSOAPMessageUsingSOAPExtensions>]](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/97d81ace-95e7-4acc-ae39-9692a0021e95).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref> class with the <xref href="System.Reflection.MethodInfo"></xref> passed in.
The property of the method_info parameter is `true`.
-or-
The method of the method_info parameter does not contain all the parameters required by the method represented by the instance of .
Gets the parameter information for the AsyncCallback parameter of a Begin method in an asynchronous invocation.
The asynchronous design pattern in the common language runtime involves calling a `Begin` method to start the asynchronous method invocation and an `End` method to complete the invocation.

The `Begin` method takes two additional parameters besides the parameters defined by the synchronous version of the method: one to store a delegate and one to store any state information that needs to be passed on to the delegate.
This property represents the parameter for the delegate with a parameter name of `AsyncCallback`.
For more information on invoking XML Web services asynchronously, see [[\<topic://cpconInvokingWebServicesAsynchronously>]](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f9e26a43-063a-440a-8c73-a02f2ccf3ea0).
A representing the AsyncCallback parameter of a `Begin` asynchronous method invocation.
Gets the return value of a `Begin` asynchronous method invocation.
The asynchronous design pattern in the common language runtime involves calling a `Begin` method to start the asynchronous method invocation and an `End` method to complete the invocation.

The `Begin` method typically returns immediately with an object implementing the <xref:System.IAsyncResult> interface, which can then be passed to the `End` method at a later time to complete the asynchronous method invocation.
The returned object implementing the <xref:System.IAsyncResult> interface is represented by this property.
For more information on invoking XML Web services asynchronously, see [[\<topic://cpconInvokingWebServicesAsynchronously>]](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f9e26a43-063a-440a-8c73-a02f2ccf3ea0).
A <xref href="System.Reflection.ParameterInfo"></xref> representing the <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> returned from a `Begin` asynchronous method invocation.
Gets the parameter information for the AsyncState parameter of a `Begin` method in an asynchronous invocation.
The asynchronous design pattern in the common language runtime involves calling a `Begin` method to start the asynchronous method invocation and an `End` method to complete the invocation.

The `Begin` method takes two additional parameters besides the parameters defined by the synchronous version of the method: one to store a delegate and one to store any state information that needs to be passed on to the delegate.
This property represents the state information that needs to be passed into the delegate.
For more information on invoking XML Web services asynchronously, see [[\<topic://cpconInvokingWebServicesAsynchronously>]](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f9e26a43-063a-440a-8c73-a02f2ccf3ea0).
A representing the AsyncState parameter of a `Begin` method in an asynchronous invocation.
Begins an asynchronous invocation of the method represented by this <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
The instance of the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> on which to invoke the method on.
An argument list for the invoked method.
This is an array of objects with the same number, order, and type as the parameters of the method.
If the method does not require any parameters, values should be `null`.
The delegate to call when the asynchronous invoke is complete.
If callback is `null`, the delegate is not called.
State information that is passed on to the delegate.

An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> which is passed to <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo.EndInvoke(System.Object,System.IAsyncResult)"></xref> to obtain the return values from the remote method call.
The target parameteris `null`.
The number, type, and order of parameters in values do not match the signature of the invoked method.
The caller does not have permission to invoke the method.
Gets the attributes and metadata for a `Begin` method in an asynchronous invocation.
A <xref href="System.Reflection.MethodInfo"></xref> representing the attributes and metadata for a `Begin` asynchronous method invocation.

Given an array of <xref href="System.Reflection.MethodInfo"></xref> that can contain information about both asynchronous and synchronous methods, creates an array of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
An array of , representing the methods within method_infos.
A `Begin` asynchronous method is included in method_infos without a corresponding `End` method.

Given an array of <xref href="System.Reflection.MethodInfo"></xref>, where the returned array of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref> can be restricted to only asynchronous or synchronous methods, creates an array of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodTypes"></xref> values.
Determines whether just asynchronous or synchronous methods or both are included in the returned array of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
An array of , representing the methods within methodInfos, filtered by the value of types.
A `Begin` asynchronous method is included in methodInfos without a corresponding `End` method.
Gets the custom attributes applied to the method.
An <xref href="System.Reflection.ICustomAttributeProvider"></xref> representing the custom attributes for the method.
Gets the class that declares the method represented by the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo.DeclaringType%2A> property retrieves a reference to a <xref:System.Type> for the type that declares this member.
A member of a class (or interface) is either declared or inherited from a base class (or interface).

The returned <xref:System.Type> might not be the same as the <xref:System.Type> of the class implementing the XML Web service (if that class derives from a base class and the method represented by this class is declared in that base class then the <xref:System.Type> returned is the base class).
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> for the class declaring the method represented by the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
Ends an asynchronous invocation of the method represented by the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
The instance of the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> on which to invoke the method.

The <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> returned from <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo.BeginInvoke(System.Object,System.Object[],System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)"></xref>.
An array of objects containing the return value and any by-reference or out parameters of the derived class method.
The target parameter is `null`.
The caller does not have permission to invoke the method.
The invoked method throws an exception.
Gets the attributes and metadata for an `End` method of an asynchronous invocation to a method.
A <xref href="System.Reflection.MethodInfo"></xref> representing the attributes and metadata for an `End` asynchronous method invocation.
Returns the first custom attribute applied to the type, if any custom attributes are applied to the type.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to which the custom attributes are applied.
An containing the first custom attribute applied to the type parameter.
The custom attribute type can not be loaded.
Returns the custom attributes applied to the specified type.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to which the custom attributes are applied.
An array of containing the custom attributes applied to type.
The custom attribute type can not be loaded.
Gets the parameters passed into the method represented by the instance of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
Use an instance of <xref:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo> to obtain information about the parameter's data type, default value, and so on.
<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo.InParameters%2A> returns an array of <xref:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo> objects representing the parameters passed into a method, in order.

An array of type <xref href="System.Reflection.ParameterInfo"></xref> containing the parameters passed into the method represented by the instance of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
Invokes the method represented by the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
The instance of the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to invoke the method.
An argument list for the invoked method.
This is an array of objects with the same number, order, and type as the parameters of the method.
If the method does not require any parameters, the values parameter should be `null`.
An array of type <xref href="System.Object"></xref> representing the return value and out parameters of the invoked method.
The target parameter is `null`.
The number, type, and order of parameters in the values parameter do not match the signature of the invoked method.
The caller does not have permission to invoke the method.
The invoked method throws an exception.
Gets a value indicating whether the method represented by the instance of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref> is invoked asynchronously.
`true` if the method is invoked asynchronously; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value indicating whether the method passed in represents a `Begin` method of an asynchronous invocation.
`true` if the method_info parameter is a `Begin` method of an asynchronous invocation; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value indicating whether the method passed in represents an `End` method of an asynchronous invocation.
`true` if the method_info parameter is an `End` method of an asynchronous invocation; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the return type for the method represented by the instance of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref> is `void`.
`true` if the return type is void; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the attributes and metadata for a synchronous method.
A <xref href="System.Reflection.MethodInfo"></xref> representing the attributes and metadata for a method.
If <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo.IsAsync"></xref> is `true`, then the value of this property is `null`.
Gets the name of the method represented by this <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
The name of the method represented by this <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
Gets the out parameters for the method.
Use a <xref:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo> to obtain information about the parameter's data type, default value, and so on.
An array of <xref href="System.Reflection.ParameterInfo"></xref> representing the out parameters for the method, in order.
Gets the parameters for the method.
Use a <xref:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo> to obtain information about the parameter's data type, default value, and so on.
<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo.Parameters%2A> returns an array of <xref:System.Reflection.ParameterInfo> objects representing the parameters passed into a method, in order.
An array of <xref href="System.Reflection.ParameterInfo"></xref> representing the parameters for the method.
Gets the return type of this method.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> returned by this method.
Gets the custom attributes for the return type.
An <xref href="System.Reflection.ICustomAttributeProvider"></xref> representing the custom attributes for the return type.
Returns a string that represents the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref>.
